level.heading: Purchase of chattel paper and instruments.
level.text: A purchaser of chattel paper or an instrument who gives new value and takes possession of it in the ordinary course of his business has priority over a security interest in the chattel paper or instrument

which is perfected under section 28:9-304 (permissive filing and temporary perfection) or under section 28:9-306 (perfection as to proceeds) if he acts without knowledge that the specific paper or instrument is subject to a security interest; or
which is claimed merely as proceeds of inventory subject to a security interest (section 28:9-306) even though he knows that the specific paper or instrument is subject to the security interest.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For legislative history of D.C. Law 4-85, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 28:9-102.
